intro: Tetranthera angusta, commonly known as the narrowleaf tetranthera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, alternate leaves that are typically lance-shaped. It produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers in late spring to early summer. Tetranthera angusta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
